pr_title: refactor: Distributed responsibilities of GoModCliExtractor to distin…

timeline.message: refactor: Distributed responsibilities of GoModCliExtractor to distinct classes (IDETECT-2174).

timeline.bodyText: This class isn't doing something particularly complex or GoMod specific.  I would have GoListUJsonGenerator call the ExecutableRunner directly and save the complication of an additional class.
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: The only reason I pulled it out is because otherwise you'd have that execute wrapper method in every class that runs a go mod command (and it didn't appear that any other detectors used that wrapper method).  If you think that would be preferable, I can do that.
replies.author: crowleySynopsys
JakeMathews

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps change this to GoModGraphGenerator to be more inline with GoListUJsonGenerator? Or vice versa. They both execute go mod commands and put that data in a useable format.
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Hmm I see your point.  I thought there might be enough of a distinction in that GoListUJsonGenerator doesn't change the output of the go mod command, it just does work to decide which command to execute, whereas GoModGraphTransformer gets the command output and then makes changes.  I'm okay calling them both generators if you disagree.
replies.author: crowleySynopsys

replies.bodyText: Okay so what if you had one class called GoModCommandExecutor that did all the executing of commands, and this class would just do the transformation.
replies.author: JakeMathews

timeline.message: refactor: Delegated all command execution to GoModCommandExecutor.
